summary: This document is an email summary of a call between Janine Gill and Pat Pillegi discussing employment and benefits records related to Mar-a-Lago. The conversation focuses on the logistics of record-keeping practices and the analysis of specific documents (GX 823) from an employee file, indicating these records are stored electronically and were part of regular business operations.

events.title: Call about Mar-a-Lago Records
events.description: A call between Janine Gill and Pat Pillegi to discuss logistics and the analysis of employment and benefits records (GX 823) from Mar-a-Lago.

keyFacts: Mar-a-Lago maintained separate employment and benefits files for employees, with records now stored electronically.
The discussion references GX 823, a document set including pages from employment and benefits files, indicating an employee may have worked for multiple clubs.
Mar-a-Lago's HR practices included creating 'Personally Action notices' by management, processed by HR, and stored in employee files as a regular practice.
Benefits enrollment at Mar-a-Lago was routinely processed within 90 days of an employee starting, with open enrollment historically on January 1.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs (7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17), indicating legal restrictions on its disclosure.
